node.text:
Digging out a basement in Washington DC Metro Areaüëá
‚†Ä
The pros and cons of having a basement largely depend on where you live. In the heavily-populated Metro Area of Washington DC, basement remodeling is often the only way to obtain more living spaceüè°. However, Washington DC basements tend to be small and too shallow to stand in.
‚†Ä
Fortunately, digging out a basement from a crawl space is always an option. Digging out a basement is a large process that involves many considerations and a lot of manpower‚õè. Hiring a dig-out basement contractor is always recommended.
‚†Ä
üìåResponsibilities of Washington DC Basement Dig-Out Contractors
‚†Ä
Basement dig-out contractors have to do a lot more than just make sure the basement has a minimum legal ceiling height of 7 feet. The basement contractor must also know how to . . .
‚úîÔ∏èMake new concrete footings
‚úîÔ∏èPour new concrete slab flooring
‚úîÔ∏èInstall foundation walls
‚úîÔ∏èLift the house to pour slab and foundation
‚úîÔ∏èCreate a legal emergency exit
‚úîÔ∏èConnect sewer lines and decide on a water or gravity-based system
‚úîÔ∏èInstall lighting, heating, plumbing and electricity
‚úîÔ∏èDecide on drain systems to prevent flooding
‚†Ä
BasementRemodeling.com: Expert Dig-Out Contractors
‚†Ä
We are the experts of basement remodeling in Maryland, DC and Virginia. If you are considering digging out a basement in Washington DC, let BasementRemodeling.com give you a fair estimate and professional advice. Contact us for a free quote today.
‚†Ä
üì± Get an instant online quote for your basement remodeling project or schedule an in-home consultation atüëá
BasementRemodeling.com
‚òéÔ∏è Feel free to call us at 877-224-2434
‚†Ä

node.text:
What is a Finished Basement (4 Requirements)üëá
‚†Ä
Basement finishing is the process of making a basement suitable to live in all year long. The best basement finishing companies will make your basement look absolutely gorgeous and add value to the home, but what is a finished basement minimum requirements?
‚†Ä
Basement finishing focuses on:
üî∏ Heating ‚Äì Basement finishing companies must install a permanent heat source (electricity, natural gas, residential or commercial propane tank, or heating oil). Portable space heaters and window units are not enough (though permanent baseboard heaters are).
üî∏¬†Flooring ‚Äì Simply painting over a concrete floor is not basement finishing. Attractive basement flooring options such as luxury vinyl tiling or laminate flooring are good choices (regular hardwood is not a good choice due to moisture concerns). High-quality carpeting is fine.
üî∏¬†Ceiling ‚Äì Most local building ordinances require a ceiling with a minimum height of seven feet. However, most basement finishing companies make the ceiling around seven-feet-nine-inches to avoid feeling too cramped. Basement tray ceilings can also add much-needed height to a room. After all, what is a finished basement good for if the ceiling is still too low?
üî∏¬†Stairs & railings ‚Äì A finished basement must be easily accessible from the rest of the house. Stairs are required; ladders will simply not do.
‚†Ä
The best basement finishing companies can add additional finishing touches such as . . .
- Columns
- Storage rooms
- Fireplaces
- Lighting
- Much more
‚†Ä
Get a basement quote from BasementRemodeling.com‚Äîthe best basement finishing company in Maryland, DC, and Virginia‚Äîand learn exactly how amazing your finished basement can be!
‚†Ä
üì± Get an instant online quote for your basement remodeling project or schedule an in-home consultation atüëá

node.text:
How to Find the Best Basement Waterproofing Companiesüëá
‚†Ä
Basement waterproofing is a labor-intensive task that needs to be done correctly the first timeü§î. Only the best waterproofing companies should be allowed to work near the foundation of your home ‚Äì but deciding who to hire is not always easy, especially if you are in a hurry. Follow these steps to find the best waterproofing companiesüëå.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èGo With Basement Contractors
‚†Ä
A waterproofing company that only sometimes works on basements is not good enough ‚Äì you want basement contractors who focus on this specific area of the house every day. If you‚Äôre having moisture problems in the basement, then it only makes sense to rely on specialized basement contractors.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èExperience is Key
‚†Ä
The best basement waterproofing companies have been around for at least 10 years, but even this is not enough. Look for a team page outlining how many years of experience each basement contractor has. This will keep you from hiring a basement waterproofing company that has been around for a long time, but suffers from a high turnover rate (which, in turn, can affect craftsmanship and cause delays).
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èReviews Matter
‚†Ä
Check the reviews for a basement waterproofing company by going on websites like Angie's List and Facebook. When you speak with the waterproofing company, ask if they‚Äôve ever operated under a different company name and, if so, check for reviews under that name as well. The best waterproofing companies will have a good reputation with the Better Business Bureau.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èComplete Repair Jobs
‚†Ä
The best basement companies will do a complete repair job themselves. They will not make you hire additional basement contractors to complete simple tasks such as removing framework, drywall or plumbing. The best basement companies will always do a full clean-up job themselves after they are finished waterproofing the basement.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èGet Basement Waterproofing With BasementRemodeling.com
‚†Ä
We have been in business since 2006 and provide expert waterproofing services in MD, Washington DC, and VA. We are fully licensed in MD, DC, and VA and have the experience to fully remodel your basement beyond expectations.

node.text:
This unique basement remodeling project, which was designed and completed by BasementRemodeling.com, was for a home in McLean, VA.
‚†Ä
A beautiful spiral staircase with black railing and wood-coated steps leads from the main floor down to the basement. The basement family room is spacious, with plenty of both artificial and natural light.
‚†Ä
The side of family room features a sizeable bar-type seating area with an adjacent cabinet/countertop combo with plenty of storage and a sink. A portion of the countertop is tucked behind a wall, with the corner showcasing tasteful wall-mounted storage racks for a wine collection.
‚†Ä
Overall, the basement area measures a total of 925 square feet.
‚†Ä

node.text:
5 Benefits of Custom Bulkhead Doorsüëá
‚†Ä
Custom bulkhead doors swing open from the ground; they are a tradition in the northeast region and were once used as the main entrance in homesüè°.
‚†Ä
Though they have since lost their spot as the main entrance with the passage of time, custom bulk doors still have a place in your next basement finishing or remodeling project.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èSafety Compliance
‚†Ä
Maryland, Washington DC, and Virginia building codes all require basements to have an easy way out in the event of an emergency. The outward opening motion of custom bulkhead doors provide the smoothest escape possible in case of emergency.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èWeather Resistant
‚†Ä
Basement doors can be customized to meet the needs of your geographical location. Custom bulkhead doors in Virginia, Maryland and Washington DC are typically built slightly submerged in the ground and sealed, making them immune to floods and high rains.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èSecurity
‚†Ä
Old basement doors can be pried open and are easy for criminals to break into. Custom basement doors come with the latest lock technologies meant to keep your valuables safe.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èDurability and Cost
‚†Ä
Custom basement doors are built to last for a long time and do not require much maintenance. The airtight sealant can also keep heat in your home, saving on energy bills every year.
‚†Ä
‚úîÔ∏èCustom Bulkhead Doors Look Fantastic
‚†Ä
Custom-built bulkhead doors are appealing to the eye. The intricate look of custom wooden bulkhead doors is simply stunning, while metal bulkhead doors have a style all of their own.
‚†Ä
üì± Get an instant online quote for your basement remodeling project or schedule an in-home consultation atüëá
BasementRemodeling.com
